alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 17 at 1:14PM MDT until April 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND THE SANDIA, MANZANO AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT TUESDAY FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE SOUTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Critical fire weather conditions will continue over the central and northeast highlands through this evening where strong northwest winds combine with very low humidity and unstable conditions. A few hours of elevated fire weather are expected Monday before yet another widespread critical fire weather event develops Tuesday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Much of northern, central, and western NM Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 13%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
